intro: Platylepis leucocephala, commonly known as the white-headed daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a compact, bushy habit. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in spring and summer. Platylepis leucocephala is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
